org.javaconfig.api

Interface ConfigurationNode

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Configuration, FreezedConfiguration, FreezedConfigurationNode
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AggregatedConfigurationNode, FilteringConfigurationNode

    public interface ConfigurationNode
    Models a node within the current configuration tree.
    Author:
    Anatole Tresch

    • Method Detail

      • findNodes

        java.util.Collection<ConfigurationNode> findNodes(java.lang.String expression)
        Access a child node using a path expression, e.g. myconfig/my*\/foo/bar.
        Parameters:
        expression - the node expression
        Returns:
        the nodes found, never null.

      • getBooleanProperty

        java.lang.Boolean getBooleanProperty(java.lang.String key)
        Get the property value as Boolean.
        Parameters:
        key - the property's absolute, or relative path, e.g. @code a/b/c/d.myProperty}.
        Returns:
        the property's value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no such property exists.

        Parameters:
        key - the property's absolute, or relative path, e.g. @code a/b/c/d.myProperty}.
        defaultValue - the default value, returned if no such property exists or the property's value is null.
        Returns:
        the property's value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value could not be converted to the required target type.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        The (partial) path name of the node, never null.
        Returns:
        the path name.

      • getNode

        ConfigurationNode getNode(java.lang.String key)
        Access a child node using either a
        • a direct child name, e.g. mycomp, or
        • a relative path, e.g. mycomp/foo/bar, or
        • an absolute path, e.g. /myconfig/mycomp/foo/bar.
        Parameters:
        key - the absolute or relative path
        Returns:
        the child node found, or null.

      • getProperties

        java.util.List<PropertyValue> getProperties()
        Access all property entries attached to this configuration instance.
        Returns:
        all entries, never null.

      • getProperty

        <T> T getProperty(java.lang.String key,
                java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Get the property value as type Class<T>.

        If Class<T> is not one of Boolean, Short, Integer, Long, Float, Double, BigInteger, BigDecimal, String , an according Converter must be available to perform the conversion from String to Class<T>.

        Parameters:
        key - the property's absolute, or relative path, e.g. @code a/b/c/d.myProperty}.
        type - the required target type.
        Returns:
        the property's value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value could not be converted to the required target type, or no such property exists.

      • getProperty

        <T> T getProperty(java.lang.String key,
                java.lang.Class<T> type,
                PropertyAdapter adapter)
        Get the property value as type Class<T>.

        If Class<T> is not one of Boolean, Short, Integer, Long, Float, Double, BigInteger, BigDecimal, String , an according Converter must be available to perform the conversion from String to Class<T>.

        Parameters:
        key - the property's absolute, or relative path, e.g. @code a/b/c/d.myProperty}.
        type - the required target type.
        converter - the Converter to perform the conversion from String to Class<T>, not null.
        Returns:
        the property's value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value could not be converted to the required target type, or no such property exists.

      • getProperty

        <T> T getProperty(java.lang.String key,
                java.lang.Class<T> type,
                T defaultValue)
        Get the property value as type Class<T>.

        If Class<T> is not one of Boolean, Short, Integer, Long, Float, Double, BigInteger, BigDecimal, String , an according Converter must be available to perform the conversion from String to Class<T>.

        Parameters:
        key - the property's absolute, or relative path, e.g. @code a/b/c/d.myProperty}.
        type - the required target type.
        defaultValue - the default value, returned if no such property exists or the property's value is null.
        Returns:
        the property's value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value could not be converted to the required target type.

      • getProperty

        <T> T getProperty(java.lang.String key,
                java.lang.Class<T> type,
                T defaultValue,
                PropertyAdapter adapter)
        Get the property value as type Class<T>.
        Parameters:
        key - the property's absolute, or relative path, e.g. @code a/b/c/d.myProperty}.
        type - the required target type.
        defaultValue - the default value, returned if no such property exists or the property's value is null.
        converter - the Converter to perform the conversion from String to Class<T>, not null.
        Returns:
        the property's value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value could not be converted to the required target type.

      • isNodePresent
